intro: Hieracium subvillosiflorum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, fuzzy appearance. Its yellow flowers are typically arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypselae. Hieracium subvillosiflorum is often found in meadows and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils.
